results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists n terms, starting with 1, such that the difference between successive terms is equal to n-3.
comment: Note that for n>1 the last term of the n-th row is the square A000290(n-2).
Row sums are the positive terms of A162607. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 24 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 100 rows, flattened
mathematica: Table[1 + k*(n-3), {n, 1, 20}, {k, 0, n-1}]// Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 21 2018 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1, 20, for(k=0,n-1, print1(1 + k*(n-3), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 21 2018
(MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[1 + k*(n-3): k in [0..n-1]]: n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 21 2018
